page.title: 04LIFE ON THE LAND
page.content: Our farms vary from large arable to small mixed holdings matched to the downlands where most have areas of grassland carrying 7 beef, 5 dairying, 2 sheep and 2 pig herds. Modern methods allow pig slurry to be pumped to distant fields as natural fertilizer. One farmer has an aircraft and another has dug a pond to encourage the return of wildfowl. There are many lovely views and ancient sites in the fields. Farmers worry about capital investment and returns. But they almost all seem to enjoy their life: hospitable and ready to help each other out, sons seem to follow their fathers into a way of life. They may live rather isolated lives in their houses and out in the fields but they and their wives are active in village life, welcoming interest in their work
